thread.title: Africa: Seacom Brings Africa Closer to Central Europe With Germany's Internet Exchange
thread.title_full: Africa: Seacom Brings Africa Closer to Central Europe With Germany's Internet Exchange

title: Africa: Seacom Brings Africa Closer to Central Europe With Germany's Internet Exchange
text:
Kenya: Behold! the Brains Behind Kenya's First Video Game 
"Our peering arrangement at DE-CIX means that African carriers and service providers will be able to efficiently and securely exchange Internet traffic with many major providers in central and Western Europe," says Mark Tinka, Head of Engineering at SEACOM. "Since we have a full-service IP/MPLS point of presence in Frankfurt and control the experience from end to end,SEACOM can offer its customers high levels of service availability and quality at an affordable cost." 
"With the strong growth in Internet traffic between Africa and Europe, we want to help African Internet users reach the services they want to access with as few hops as possible," says Tinka. Africa
